column4: Hi all, how do I find out what driver and version my wireless uses, I'm suspecting madwifi but want to be sure...
in most cases wext works for many wifi interfaces.
is this a USB wifi device or PCI?
atheros should work...   but are you using WPA encryption?
madwifi should work with most atheros chips
did you try running iwconfig to see what it shows ?  sometimes in the nickname it gives a hint at what driver/version
look in the info for ath0  do you see a field called "nickname"?
what do you see towards the bottom when you type lsmod?
type lsmod and then look for something near "pci"  should list the modules loaded for that card.
also you can type dmesg when you toggle the wifi card...   and see what shows up.
toggle the wifi card again and then type dmesg.  It should output something pertaining to the card and give a clue as to what's going on./
if the drivers for the card are loaded, it SHOULD return something...   could it be that the atheros/madwifi drivers aren't loaded?
you got me on this one...  what type of card is it?
well, then it's definitely got something loaded...  I'm stumped
